Based on your search query about "The Little Prince" planets and their parallels to social media platforms and modern behaviors, I found extensive information about the various planets and characters the Little Prince encounters. The search reveals fascinating connections between Saint-Exupéry's 1943 novella and contemporary digital behaviors, particularly around social media culture.

## The Planets and Their Modern Social Media Parallels

The story follows a young prince who visits various planets, including Earth, and addresses themes of loneliness, friendship, love, and loss. The prince travels to a series of asteroids, each featuring a grown-up who has been reduced to a function.

### The Vain Man - Social Media Influencer Culture

A conceited man who only wants to be the most admired person on his otherwise uninhabited planet.(no content)The second planet the little prince visits he meets a man who loves admiration, attention, and to be assured of his absolute perfection because of how lonely he really is. The constant praise this man seeks actually hides his true feelings about himself.

This character strikingly parallels modern social media influencer culture, where obsessed with admiration and applause, he represents the epitome of vanity and the insatiable human desire for validation. His character serves as a mirror reflecting a facet of human nature often taken to absurd lengths — the need for recognition and approval from others.

### The Businessman - Digital Obsession and Ownership Culture

A businessman who is blind to the beauty of the stars and instead endlessly counts and catalogs them in order to "own" them all.(no content)This character is supposed to portray the majority of grown ups in the world. Grown ups work their butts off so they have money to buy whatever they want. Money is happiness to them which means they have no time for anything or anybody else. When the little prince meets the businessman he is too busy counting all the stars he owns and has no time to listen to the prince.

This reflects modern digital culture's obsession with metrics, followers, and virtual ownership, where he symbolizes the materialistic pursuit of wealth and the absurdity of claiming ownership over that which cannot be possessed. His obsession with numbers and ownership distracts him from the true beauty and wonder of the stars themselves.

### The King - Authority and Control in Digital Spaces

A king with no subjects, who only issues orders that will be followed, such as commanding the sun to set at sunset.(no content)He represents the absurdity of absolute power and the human obsession with authority. Despite his grandiose claims, he has no real subjects and issues orders that are inherently reasonable, highlighting the emptiness of power when it lacks purpose and connection to others.

This mirrors how some people seek authority and control in online spaces despite having no real influence or meaningful connections.

## Modern Relevance and Social Commentary

Each of these characters symbolizes different aspects of adult folly or narrow-mindedness. The prince's experiences on these planets are meant to critique the strangeness and irrationality of adult behaviors from the innocent perspective of a child.

The story's critique of materialism and superficial connections remains remarkably relevant: In the story, the little prince's encounter with the businessman highlights the pitfalls of a life driven by greed and materialism. The businessman is so consumed with counting stars and amassing wealth that he fails to appreciate the beauty and wonder of the world around him. The little prince, by contrast, finds joy in simple pleasures, like the sound of the wind and the fragrance of a flower.

The Little Prince's journey ultimately teaches that true happiness and fulfilment come not from material possessions but from the relationships we build with others. This message resonates strongly in our current era of social media platforms where authentic connection often gets lost in the pursuit of likes, followers, and digital validation.
